byline.contributor: Paul Mozur reported from Hong Kong, and Jane Perlez from Beijing.
byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and JANE PERLEZ

abstract: United States officials block Chinese bid to buy controlling stake in unit of Dutch electronics company Philips for up to $2.9 billion; cite national security concerns; China's push into production of microchips has alarmed some observers, who cite potential military applications.
lead_paragraph: Chips with military as well as electronics uses came under focus when Washington officials killed a $2.9 billion Chinese investment.

headline.main: Concern Grows in U.S. Over China’s Drive to Make Chips
headline.print_headline: China’s Drive Into Chips Draws Notice in the U.S.

snippet: Chips with military as well as electronics uses came under focus when Washington officials killed a $2.9 billion Chinese investment.

keywords.value: Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS)
keywords.name: organizations
